comments:
Description:

Column binding "CUSTOMERNUMBER" does not exist when insert two data row into the same column of the grid.



Steps to reproduce:

1.Add a grid in layout view.
2.Create a sample data source
3.Create a data set with table "CUSTOMERS"
4.Bind grid to dataset in Properties sheet.
5.Add data row["customernumber"] and row ["customername"] to the same grid column
6.Select the grid column containing the data, add a map: if row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"] = 103, display "A"
7.Add another map: if row["customername"] = "Atelier graphique", display "B"
8.Preview

Expected Result:
Preview with no error

Actual Result:
Throw errors

Error log:
The following items have errors: 


Data (id = 352): 
- Column binding "CUSTOMERNUMBER" does not exist. 
data.engine.ColumnBindingNotExist ( 1 time(s) )

Java script is a case censitive language.The column bindings of BIRT follow this convension.
Although I have changed the ["customername"] and ["customernumber"] to upper case. The problem still there.
